snippet: Norwegian Air Shuttle's plan to offer cut-rate flights across the Atlantic has been fiercely opposed by airlines and pilots in the United States and Europe.
abstract: Norwegian Air Shuttle says its long-distance subsidiary has formally received operating license from Ireland; budget carrier can now seek approval for a plan to offer cut-rate flights across the Atlantic, which has been fiercely opposed by airlines and pilots in the United States and Europe.
lead_paragraph: Norwegian Air Shuttle's plan to offer cut-rate flights across the Atlantic has been fiercely opposed by airlines and pilots in the United States and Europe.

headline.main: With U.S. in Sights, Norwegian Airline Wins Irish License
